channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023061700
item.description:
Report X-2023061700

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found damaged on a trailer. Once it was discovered, it was brought to QA. DescribePack: The package had staining visible on the top of the box. Upon opening it, one of the bottles had a noticeably loose cap and was determined to be the source of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023070151
item.description:
Report E-2023070151

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 16, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing Zep Formula 50 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. FCE overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack for further shipping and processing. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Zep Formula 50-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, PPE, and miscellaneous debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023061676
item.description:
Report X-2023061676

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: hazmat came down the chute line and spilled out because of a loose cap. Manager called QA we cleaned the spilled product with neutralizer. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Once the package was found it was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The cap on the bottle was loose and the contents were eating through the box (due to their corrosive nature) DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage

item.title: Report I-2023060173
item.description:
Report I-2023060173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: Elizabethtown
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONNELL TRANSPORT CO. LTD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While parked at rest stop, a leak was discovered coming from the weld seam on the tank truck. Glendale Fire Department responded to assess the site. First Call Environmental was dispatched to assess and perform cleanup. Upon arrival on site, leak was discovered coming from weld seam at back of truck, cause could not be determined. As product was coal tar pitch, heat was turned off inside tank, which caused product to cool and solidify over time. First Call Environmental monitored the site until no further release was detected and product had hardened within tank. First Call Environmental proceeded to scrape the product from the affected asphalt and surrounding seam on tank and recovered all product from the area. Disposal will be coordinated in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures reported.
